name: Tabacon Grand Spa Thermal Resort

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: My teen-age daughters and I stayed two nights here last week and we loved it. We went 3 times to the hotel hot springs, which were magical and one of the highlights of our trip to Costa Rica.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not stay at the Tabacon resort overnight. We actually stayed at Arenal Observatory Lodge about 15 minutes away so we could watch the volcano at night. However, the Tabacon Hot Springs was probably the highlight of our trip. It is well worth the price of admission. We decided to stay in La Fortuna overnight, which was a great decision. FYI, if you take an Areanl Volcano and Tabacon Springs full day tour that leaves from most places in Costa Rica, you will not get the whole experience nor be able to fully enjoy these natural wonders. We bought the $45 evening pass, which people have said daytime is better. I beg to differ- although daytime is probably still awesome (and you can take visible pictures of your experience), nighttime was just as awesome. Granted, it does get crowded around 6:00 and 7:00 PM, but rest assured, these tour groups leave by 8:00 PM and you have most of the springs to yourself until close (10:00 PM). I would advise people to bring water shoes if you want to climb through the springs. There are a lot of large rocks when you step in, and you may either hurt yourself or lose balance without the water shoes. Flip-flops won't work... there's too much current from the springs. Once you get in, there is so much to explore. There are numerous different springs throughout, different temperatures, all of them relaxing. The landscaping is awe-inspiring, and just gorgeous. The only drawback of this resort is they overcharge for everything. The drinks were definitely American prices. But I guess if you expect it and prepare yourself for it, you won't be disappointed. I didn't mind paying a little extra to have the experience of sitting in the warm pool swim up bar. We will definitely be going back, and next time we'll stay at the resort.
reviews.title: Went For the Hot Springs- Great Memory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the worst hotel of the 3 that I stayed in costa rica...the other 2...peace lodge and punta islita offered so much more than the tabacon hotel offered. I went to costa rica on my honeymoon and expecteed so much more from this hotel. The highlight was the access to the hot springs but i am recommending to all my friends find another hotel and just pay for the day to go. The worst part was the service, My husband and I were ignored at the resturaunt, Im not sure if its because my hair and eyes were too dark the staff provide you with the bare minimum in service. This experience was so different than the other places as we actually interacted and had conversations with staff. That wasnt the case here. We actually looked forward to leaving this place.. as one of the other tourist that we met described it was an upscale holiday inn. I will never be back....I will visit the area again..but not the hotel.
reviews.title: overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tabacon resort Feb 2008. The weather was approx in the upper 70's low 80's...and much cooler at night. A good mix with the tepid waters of the hot springs. It was a great, relaxing place. We were so glad to finally get there. It was a long trip from San Jose where we flew into. (about three hours of twisting roads). It made me happy to finally be there. Check in was easy, and we were greeted with a tropical drink. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a nice view of the volcano. The hot springs are a brisk walk down steps and a must do. We induldged in a tabacon massage ....I highly recommend a spa treatment. The hotel itself never seemed crowded; though, the hot springs themselves were crowded. You could find more secluded areas while walking around though. I guess it is just when you first walk in...it looks too crowded. They have a nice buffet style restaurant and a swim up bar for lite fare. We also ventured into the town of La Fortuna for souvenir shopping and dinner one night. There are other excursions available. We didn't have time for much more; we only here about a day and a half and then we were off to the pacific coast to Manuel Antonio and stayed at hotel Si Como No. See my review if interested. Happy travels!
reviews.title: totally tabacon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to Costa Rica, this MUST be on the top of your list. It takes three hours to drive there from the airport - we rented a car, and had no problem getting there. The hotel is located at the base of a big volcano in the rain forest around hot springs. There are a million exotic flowers and parrots and fresh fruit. The service was great, room service was awesome, the spa was amazing.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We went to the Tabacon for a one day excursion from san jose, costa rica...this place was amazing, beautiful water falls and hot springs, it was almost like a dream. The tropical trees and the water was heavenly, I would recommend water shoes tho, because you are walking on rocks in the springs...we were a little disappointed that the drinks were so expensive at the swim up bar, good thing, it was only a day excursion.
reviews.title: unbelievable!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at The Tabacon for our 3 night stay. We were welcomed by a wonderful fruit drink and cool cloths to start our relaxation. Check in was fairly easy. This hotel is paradise. The rooms are big, most comfy beds, great jetted tub in bathroom. We opted for the breakfast plan and glad we did. It was exceptional and a great start to our tours for the day. We did the hanging bridge tour and white water rafting booked through Swiss travel and were happy with both. I want to emphasize how geat our white water rafting day was. This was with a company called Aquas Bravis and they were really terrific. After a few hours of hitting the river and this included class I, II and III, we were then brought to a working farm where we had the best home grwon lunch. This farm also had real sugar cane moonshine! Cannot say enough about our experience at the Tabacon and this part of Costa Rica. We felt very safe going in to la Fortuna for dinner, walking the hot springs at night and generally all over. Our next stop was the RIU in Guanacast which was nice to be on the beach but if I go back, I would stay in the rain forest again.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: This place wasn't part of the original travel plans I'd made with my friend, but once we got to La Fortuna, we were told the Tabacon hot springs were not to be missed, and were significantly better than any of the others. So we prepared ourselves to pay the $70 for the evening pass to the springs - and we were not disappointed. It was amazing!!
reviews.title: Worth every penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: There were a dozen naturally heated pools (and I use the term loosely since all but one have a natural volcanic rock bottom) with lush, tropical vegetation, waterfalls to sit under, a swim up bar with a waterslide and each pool was a different tenperature. It was perfect! Drinks at the bar were expensive at $10 each, but we were so relaxed and feeling so good that we didn't care. We met several couples on their honeymoons, for which the place seemed ideally suited.
reviews.title: The perfect place for Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: One thing to note- we were traveling during the last week of low season, but were told that during high season you have to prepay for your tickets to be guaranteed to get in since there is such a high demand. For us it wasn't that busy or crowded, and after all of our concerns about the cost, they only ended up charging us $40 instead of $70 (i think it's $70 if you want to do the buffet dinner, which we skipped). I loved every minute - if you're interested in La Fortuna, you can't miss this place. It was easily the best part of our trip!
reviews.title: Annual family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the long and winding ride from San Jose this was paradise. I definitely recommend a driver or shuttle as others have mentioned, I cannot imagine driving it. The welcome was really nice and the room was large, clean with a view of the volcano from our own little back yard and a huge plasma tv. In addition to the wonderful people of CR and all the tours you can do like the Arenal Volcano hike and the zip line the highlight of our 3 night stay was the Thermal Hot Springs just up the road within walking distance. We walked there every day we were there before or after our tours. The morning is the most peaceful time there. I have never seen such lush beauty and felt such theraputic waters. THIS IS A MUST! And of course the Grand Spa is also a must. A massage outside in a tropical paradise with the sounds of birds and the hot springs was over the top. This place is a must stay on a visit to Costa Rica. My husband and I went for our anniversary and can't wait to go back with our kids.
reviews.title: Love this place!

likes.liked: — The cleanliness, friendly staff and beautiful surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have visited Tabacon in the past and do believe the hotel/resort is of quality, however, I wanted all visitors to be aware of my recent experience with a cancelled reservation.
reviews.title: Cancelled Reservation(s) - Be Aware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In early January of this year I had cancelled a reservation 21 days prior to my planned arrival, fully aware that a $30 penalty would be administered. However, what I was not aware of is that the reservation expense on my credit card would not be reimbursed (minus the $30) until 3 months later! It took many frusterating phone calls and emails to the Resort to AT LAST get my monies reimbursed.
reviews.title: OVERATED!!!
Wonderful Time!!!
reviews.text: My only warning is to make sure the dates you book are the dates you plan to keep --- I would hate for anyone else to encounter the same LACK OF customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: We visited Tabacon towards the end of November 2007. I had made the reservations months ahead of time and had really been looking forward to the hotel, spa & hot springs experience. My husband and I were married in Costa Rica and were on our honeymoon. A member of the wedding party was still traveling with us and was staying in La Fortuna at Posada Inn. He came with us for check in so he'd know where our room was because we were staying there 4 nights. Obviously since we were on our honeymoon this person was not staying with us but we did do things together during the day like go on excursions and out to eat together. We had plans for my husband and I to get unpacked in the room and then we'd all go down to the hot springs together... then grab a bite to eat.
reviews.title: inacceptable behaviour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Tabacon during a recent vacation in Costa Rica. It was definitely worth the drive to Arena and we enjoyed staying in the resort. We opted for the cheaper garden room suite with no view of the Volcano. This worked out perfectly as the volcano had cloud cover at the top throughout our three day visit. You can also see the volcano from all over the area, so I don't feel like we missed out on anything. Our room was spacious and very clean. We had a large plasma TV (this worked out well for watching a DVD during a rainy afternoon). We enjoyed walking to the hot springs each day. I would say that it is worth paying the extra to stay at Tabacon for unlimited use of the hotsprings and avoiding the $55 per person charge. We would walk over there at the end of each day for some relaxation before dinner.
reviews.title: Pricey but you won't be disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a lot to do in the area and having our own car we were able to do several trips and without using the "tourdesk" service and incurring the extra cost. We visited the hanging bridges, Arenal National Park and did an ATV ride. If it hadn't been raining during our visit we would have done a lot more as there was plenty to do in the area.
reviews.title: Cool, relaxing and worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also ate most of our meals in Fortuna rather than in the resort which saved us some money.
reviews.title: highly attractive

likes.liked: — room with terrace and view, restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would certainly stay here again if I visited the area and would recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Beware of broken fixtures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know why so many people hated this resort- WE LOVED IT!!! My boyfriend and I wanted to stay here for one night before heading to Quepos to spend a week with my family. We researched a lot about Tabacon and decided to stay at the resort and not somewhere around it. We were so happy we made that decision.
reviews.title: tabacon works wonders!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're visiting Arenal in Costa Rica, Tabacon Hot Springs is definitely the place to stay. The staff are all very friendly and professional, and tend to every need you have: taxis, scheduling spa/
reviews.title: Tabacon is the Place to Stay in Arenal

likes.disliked: — Lack of Good Places to Eat in the Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: massage treatment, recommending restaurants, renting DVDs, etc.
reviews.title: Heaven in the rainforest!

likes.liked: — Hot springs are gorgeous, rainforest at its best!
likes.disliked: — Did not stay at the hotel (expensive and 2-night minimum). Not necessary to stay there unless you are on honeymoon. Hot spring is down and across the street from hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because you're in the middle of the jungle, don't expect the room to be like the Four Seasons. But the rooms are decent (nothing special) and they do have a nice patio area that is basically connected to the jungle. I regret that we didn't get a room that faced the volcano, as many of the other guests noted that they saw lava coming from the volcano from their room.
reviews.title: An Oasis not to be missed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the primary reason you should book with Tabacon is that the guests get unlimited visits to their natural hot springs (remember that the place is built at the foot of a volcano). Usually, entrance to the hot springs is $30 per person per visit. So the room will basically pay for itself if you visit often enough. The hot springs is a great place to just relax. There is also a heated pool in the area with a swim up bar, which you can start a tab with your room if you stay at Tabacon. There is also a spa area, where you can get a nice massage, which I would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I think Tabacon is the place to stay if you're going to Arenal.
reviews.title: Tabacon is sublime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Tabacon is a beautiful resort and is all about the thermal springs - naturally heated mineral water from the Arenal volcano. The grounds are lush and the rooms are large and comfortable. They have nice locker room facilities to change and shower so you can spend the whole day at the springs easy enough. There is a nice swim up bar in the main pool area, and a couple restaurants on the grounds. But the service at the front desk leaves much to be desired. They refused to even give me the room keys until 4pm, which is check-in time. We got there at 1:30pm after a long drive and checked back at 3:30pm to see if the room was ready. They said it wasn't ready, when in reality it was clean as waited infront of the room from 3:30pm-4pm and no maid was cleaning. A maid did enter the room right at 4pm and took in robes. But they did insist on charging my credit card in full at 1:30pm. I also watched the woman at the front deak hassle another guest about the clarity of their signature as it did not look like the signature on their passport, which they had just taken to make a copy of. Tabacon markets themselves as a 5 star member of the Leading Hotels of the World chain, but that is not how a 5 star hotel treats their guests.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting and springs, but not 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apparently at Tabacon you are expected to be awake at 6am, so if you like to sleep in on your vacation, this is not the place for you. After being rudely awoken the first morning by the help as they stomped along by our room door, I was really amazed the second morning when at 6:30am a man who worked for the hotel proceeded to stand outside our room and have a VERY loud conservation on his radio. I went to the door in my robe, stuck my head out and informed him we were trying to sleep, he didn't even apologize, he gave ME a dirty look, and 5 minutes after I shut the door he did it again! For a Leading Hotel of the World, they really fall down in this area. The tiles and lack of sound proofing mean you hear everyone walking by your room and your neighbors in their rooms.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went here for 3 days on the first stop of our honeymoon!
reviews.title: Beyond Anything We Imagined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Tabacon Resort and Spa was by far the most sensational place I have ever stayed in my life. With your key, you have unlimited access to the World Famous Tabacon Hot Springs, which is a place of incomparable beauty. We found ourselves in a luscious rainforest on a scale that reminded you of Jurassic Park, and it just went on and on. We didn't want to leave.
reviews.title: A New Synonym for Fantastic - Tabacon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But when we did, we found an immensely helpful staff, a restaurant that we just were thrilled by with every meal (it is expensive), a big and comfy room with all the sounds of the rainforest from your balcony and a deep jacuzzi (that could seat 3 easily) besides all the comforts of home you could imagine. Besides that there were many memorable experiences. The private bungalow dinner was so romantic and fun. The staff were great. Room service was prompt and a blast (we've never had it before). We were helped with choosing the zipline tour which was awesome and again the place is kept perfectly.
reviews.title: Amazing hot springs and wildlife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: A fantastic visit into the rainforest. Nestled into the lush tropics, hot springs overflowing all around you.....view of the volcano and nothing to do but stroll around the trees and hop in and out of the hot, healing waters. The spa was FANTASTIC and i go to lots of spas. The food was wonderful. There was limited seating by the pool, but a nice pool bar. More of an active atmosphere. Nearby there was amazing ziplining and hanging bridge trails. My kids LOVED the slide by the pool. A bit of a trek to get there from the airport...but it was a fun luxury adventure.
reviews.title: Go for the delicious hot waters, the spa and the eden-like surroundings.
Beautiful hotel and hot springs expensive food
reviews.text: Beautiful property but is far from city center, thus nickel and dimes for food, so if you want to eat or drink anything be ready to cash out your 401K. The hot springs are amazing, and a must see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in December. The hotel grounds and pools were amazing! We saw lots of wildlife and went to the hot springs several times. The room was spacious, clean, and looked beautiful. The location was close enough to drive to town, but far enough to feel like you're in the wilderness. The staff was very nice and everyone was friendly. To be nit picky, our air conditioner vent made a buzzing noise the whole time, our lights would sporadically turn off, and the bed was not very comfortable for a hotel of this stature. All of those things could have been easily ignored, however, we felt that for the price of almost $400 a night, things like that should not happen. It would be worth it to stay in the summer during the wet season, but not worth it for the price at peak season. There are many hotels that are probably nice as well close to town also.
reviews.title: Very nice place, but price too high for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the " Love in Costa Rica, Romance in the Wild" package for our honeymoon, and Tabacon was part 2. Checked in and then proceeded to the Grand Spa at the Tabacon Hot Springs (1-2 min complimentary shuttle drive from the hotel). Had the couples massage, then had the ($35/pp) dinner buffet at the Hot Springs afterwards. Our room had some Welcome sliced fresh fruit on the table upon our arrival. Nicest room of the 3 places we stayed with a full size jacuzzi in room. AC did make a rattling noise from time to time and turn down service failed to come once. Breakfast buffet was included and was very tasty and comprehensive. Had one dinner on site ($50pp) but worth doing at least once. Had a tandoori lunch once and the buffet dinner twice at the hot springs restaurant. We did the combination tour of the Hanging Bridges, La Fortuna waterfall, lunch in town, and the Arenal Hike. It rained all morning and our guide suggested we defer our Arenal hike to the following morning. Thank goodness we did since it cleared up and we were able to see most of the volcano. That afternoon we went back to the volcano for the Sky Trek zip-line. It's a MUST. Of course, the real MUST are the Hot Springs. We went 3 times. The service was good but less personable than the other properties we visited as it was the largest of the 3.
reviews.title: Yes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I purchased a buffet dinner reservation for 2 on Christmas day. I however had to cancel my trip due to an emergency and provided them with 3 days notice; on the day this notice was provided an assurance was given by myself to come to costa rica somewhere in feburary 2012 (since i have to use my airline tickets) however these unreasonable people expected me to reschedule in 1 day time or lose my US$140.00 a bunch of total scamps. Customer Facilitation does not exist at this place
reviews.title: big mistake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 6 nights at this wonderful property. 4 would have been enough.
reviews.title: Great Experence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thermal spa and gardens and amenities surrounding are outstanding and unique.
reviews.title: luxury in the rainforest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Friendly, helpful staff and excellent facilities. Don't miss the sky-tram/zip-lining tour
reviews.title: Lovely staff, well kept grounds, very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: What can I say about this resort, the rooms are gorgeous. We had the deluxe room with a birds eye view of the rain forest. A sunken tub about 26" deep roomy enough for 4 adults and one toddler to almost swim in comfortably. Lovely robes and slippers, a shower, fresh fruit every morning and greeting drinks for one and all.
reviews.title: Great Thermal Waterfalls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort is not far from the 'town' where you can get great typical Costa Rican food. The restaurants often start with 'tipico' in the name.
reviews.title: Very good thermal spa

aka: Tabacon Grand Spa Thermal Hotel La Fortuna De San Carlos
description: Tabacón Grand Spa Thermal Resort is a five stars hotel located in Costa Rica's northern region, at the foot of the majestic Arenal Volcano in the heart of the tropical rainforest. Tabacón provides luxurious accommodations, services and amenities in a picture-perfect natural setting. The unique thermal springs emerge from the volcanic earth, cascading to form waterfalls, streams, tranquil pools and ponds surrounded by lush tropical gardens which create an oasis of peace. The hotel, member of The Leading Hotels of The World, offers 7 different categories of rooms: Ambassador Suite, Senator Suite Tabacon Suite, Honeymoon Suite, Rainforest Suite, Superior Premium and Superior, each room with amenities that will offer all the comfort for an unforgettable stay.As a perfect complement of a relaxing experience, inside the gardens you can find The Grand Spa, member of Leading Spas of the World. The Grand Spa taps one of the world´s beautiful locations to offer an incomparable spa experience. Treatments are given in 11 open-air bungalows, all with Jacuzzi.
